reviewText: I cannot say enough about this particular Concert/DVD; it has something to offer every one of differing faiths, but that was always the driving force behind Peter, Paul and Mary; "Music with a Message." The Choir shows great diversity; and all their voices combined are what go into making this concert first taped in 1988 so very special. For being recorded Twenty Four years ago its quality has remained intact, no skips or jumps. I highly recommend it to anyone who may not associate PPM w/ the holidays to give it a try; you won't be disappointed.

reviewText: I firast saw this concert on P.B.S. years ago, and loved it, Of course, with all the pledge breaks it got a bit long. I attempted to record it on VHS tape and edit out the pledge breaks, but it was a pretty bad recording. I still watch it every Christmas, but on a hunch, I checked AMAZON to see if it was available on DVD. Was so thrilled to find it! Now I can watch nit without all the static and snow from my homemade copy, and especially NO PLEDGE BREAKS from PBS!
summary: One Of My All Time Favorite Holiday Concerts

reviewText: Granted the songs are not generally the traditional Christmas offerings, but they are fun & none are irreverent. Everyone from the audience to the choir seems to be having a wonderful time, & the music is well-done.My only complaint was the lack of subtitles; as a member of the PP&M; generation, my hearing is going & I'd just as soon not have to blast my neighbors with high volume to understand what is being sung or said. A flyer with the song lyrics included with the DVD would've been nice too.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This live concert can really bring you into the Christmas spirit.  The collection of songs... many holiday and several Peter, Paul and Mary classics bring a youthful zest to the heart.  Supported by the New York Choral Society and orchestra, it is a most festive event.  A stage setting, with a few solos and live audience really bring this to heart.  There should be no Christmas collection called "complete" without bringing their wonderful voices and songs into your home.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Like most, I originally saw this back on PBS in the 1980's.  While some reviewers have complained about the quality of the DVD, I can't hear or see any of that myself.  I really love Christmas music and, as I have mentioned frequently in the past, I like listening to people who can actually sing.  There were very few, if any, who could match their three part harmony.  They did several concerts for PBS, and frankly there were some of them which weren't that enjoyable, but both this one and their 25th Anniversary Concert are two of the best concerts that have ever been shown on TV.  I also feel that it was important to have this personally since Mary Traver's passing because there will be no more Peter, Paul, & Mary now.  I highly recommend this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Whether you love the holiday season, Peter, Paul and Mary, music, or all of the above, this is the concert DVD for you!  The beautiful, brilliant blend of acoustic guitars with a symphony orchestra, three-part harmonies with those belonging to an entire chorus, do the performers and the music they articulate 100% justice!  Peter, Paul and Mary present heartwarming renditions of traditional Christmas carols ("We Wish You A Merry Christmas", "O Come O Come Emmanuel", "Children Go Where I Send Thee", "O Come All Ye Faithful", "Hark The Herald Angels Sing", "Silent Night", and "Hallelujah" [with a special reprise of "We Wish You A Merry Christmas" to close the show]), reveal uplifting spirituals ("I Wonder As I Wander", "The Magi", "The Friendly Beasts", "Hayo, Haya", and "The Cherry Tree Carol"), as well as integrate their own special magic as a trio [along with being individuals in their own right] ("A' Soalin'", "'Twas The Night Before Christmas", "Light One Candle", "Weave Me The Sunshine", "The Marvelous Toy", "Puff, The Magic Dragon", "Blowin' In The Wind", and "This Land Is Your Land").This Holiday Concert is truly a gift for audiences everywhere, as Peter, Paul and Mary, the New York Choral Society and Orchestra outdo themselves in their musical merriment to ignite a sense of family, community, and an overall sense of peace and love within their surroundings.  The music of Peter, Paul and Mary, as well as the holidays themselves, could not be purer than in this outstanding performance.  All you have to do is watch and listen to it once, and it will stay with you forever.
summary: A holiday treat that can't be beat!

reviewText: Excellent quality DVD. One you will watch annually to appreciate. If you are a fan, then it's a question of disposable income.I am biased,in that Peter Paul & Mary are part of my life. God Bless Mary Travers, she was a beautiful soul.

reviewText: I bought this DVD because the music is beautiful, the program is well put together, but also because Peter, Paul, and Mary are ageless and so is their message over the decades of peace on earth and good will toward toward all mankind. ALL mankind. In this concert, I can see three generations in the audience smiling and singing along. They get the message. I had to order it so I could watch it any time I wanted and remember their message again. It's for all of us.
summary: A message for the whole year.
